Posted By: EndOsiris (5/9/2011 5:06:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Everyone who's complaining about this card should really try playing around with it first and learn a little bit more about how to use it.  
  
1. Amazing first turn, even with the two life loss. It simply means that second turn you should start swinging to regain that life.  
  
2. Flyers are pretty difficult to get around in a lot of popular decks, and even if you're facing something with a flyer, this thing will hit the field faster and start swinging before your opponent can even start blocking.  
  
3. Sure, he's really easy to get rid of, but with the right protection, it'll sit on the field for a good while. Throw a Tempered Steel down and this becomes 3/3, but there's even better options. I run a white Quest deck and this is my first and second choice for Argentum Armor. That makes it a 7/7 with lifelink and opposition destruction. That's hard to beat, no matter how you slice it.  
  
4. And if it does get removed, you should have 3 more. Sure, it costs another 2 life, but chances are that you... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

3. Sure, he's really easy to get rid of, but with the right protection, it'll sit on the field for a good while. Throw a Tempered Steel down and this becomes 3/3, but there's even better options. I run a white Quest deck and this is my first and second choice for Argentum Armor. That makes it a 7/7 with lifelink and opposition destruction. That's hard to beat, no matter how you slice it.

Posted By: DeathDark (6/26/2011 5:50:21 PM)

posts.post_content:
The Agent of Bolas likes this little sucker. Almost a Baneslayer. Plus, it can be played on turn 2 after an everflowing chalice.  
  
And who would seriously waste removal on this?   
  
Exactly. That's why it's good, like all those annoying little critters out there that gain you 1 life when a creature enters the battlefield. It seems pointless to waste removal on it, yet if you don't, you're screwed.  
  
Edit: This little Imp also happens to have protection from black's most common removal suite in Standard: Doom Blade AND Go for the Throat. Pretty nifty, huh?  
Edit 2: Already been mentioned, I see...

posts.post_content:
Strengths:  
1. Its a early game drop that can give you life advantage.  
2. Cheap cost.  
3. Cheap Black flier.  
4. Playable in any color.  
5. Effects that specify creature, color or artifact will trigger for this creature.  
  
Weaknesses:  
1. Easily removed, even more so then normal creatures.  
2.Effects that specify creature, color or artifact will trigger for this creature.  
  
I think Its strengths out way its weaknesses.

Posted By: Yozuk (5/6/2011 3:48:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really like this guy.  
  
First off, I can think of very few cases when you *wouldn't* want to pay the 2 life to get him out early. As so many others have pointed out, his flying and lifelink mean that within a couple turns, especially early in the game, you'll make up that life, no problem. Add any sort of pump--even something like [Tainted Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tainted Strike) or [Virulent Swipe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Virulent Swipe) for something in color--and he makes it up in a single hit, making him, for all intents and purposes, a one-drop.  
  
Second, as a black artifact creature, he's in the peculiar position of being resistant to both [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) *and* [Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat). Sure, he'll die to [Grasp of Darkness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grasp of Darkness), [Spread the Sickness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spread the Sickness), [Glissa's Scorn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glissa's Scorn), or [Shatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shatter), but those are all either a little more specialized or more expensive than Doom Blade or Go for the Throat. Even if your op... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Add any sort of pump--even something like Tainted Strike or Virulent Swipe for something in color--and he makes it up in a single hit, making him, for all intents and purposes, a one-drop.

Second, as a black artifact creature, he's in the peculiar position of being resistant to both Doom Blade and Go for the Throat. Sure, he'll die to Grasp of Darkness, Spread the Sickness, Glissa's Scorn, or Shatter, but those are all either a little more specialized or more expensive than Doom Blade or Go for the Throat. posts.post_content:
Using him in my legacy MBC. Combine him with [Virulent Swipe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Virulent Swipe) for fast life-loss or to kill off a big flyer while chumping; regaining your life. Note that he'll \*almost\* always get you your life back or cost them a card, or both.   
  
Keeping just a little bit of pump in your deck is enough to make this guy very lethal.
posts.html:

Keeping just a little bit of pump in your deck is enough to make this guy very lethal.

I think the hatred for this card comes from the people that also first thought [Gut Shot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gut Shot) was useless: *2 life for 1 damage? No a chance!*  
  
This thinking also under-shot other cards like [Birthing Pod](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birthing Pod) and [Dismember](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dismember) at first... until the "[Dark Confident](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Confident)" came to overtook that.

Posted By: Ferlord (7/16/2012 8:17:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Wow, this is something I have been looking for, for quite some years now. Why didn't I find this one?  
Artifact creatures with attack power that can be played in turn 1 are already not very common. If they have the ability lifelink, than this is awesome since it is very hard to put life gaining in an artifact deck. And with flying on it, this is unbelievable. What about [Cranial Plating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cranial Plating), [Welding Jar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Welding Jar) or [Master of Etherium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master of Etherium)? And indeed, [Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas) is a big fan of this one!  
But also think about [Arcbound Ravager](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcbound Ravager) that can be used to sacrifice himself to get some counters on this flying Angel...sorry: Imp

posts.post_content:
@ Shiny\_Espeon  
I really think you're missing the point of this guy. 1 cost flying and lifelink, that's pretty nasty. 1 cost flying is already pretty impressive, as is 1 cost lifelink, but both? That's remarkable. It isn't meant to win you the game, but it is as helpful a little bugger as you'll ever find. It may be easy to kill, but it's even easier to bring out another one, and if you're opponent is willing to waste burn/destroy cards on a one-drop, let them.  
He's a good card to keep out if for nothing else besides pinging your opponent and making him waste kill cards.
